title: 99 Days - Updated
description:
[b]Detail:[/b]
Title: 99 Days
Genre: Drama/Gay Interest
Release Date: 30 Nov 2008 (Hong Kong)
Runtime: 8 Episodes - 13-23 minutes each
Country: China (Hong Kong)
Language: Cantonese
Subtitles: English

[b]EPISODES:[/b]
8 episodes; 13-23 minutes each

[b]MAIN CAST:[/b]
Zeon Chang as Chris/Lok (20 years old)
Bosco Jiu as Tom/Chun (16 years old)
Tommy Wong as Don (16 years old)
North Chalk as Mike (28 years old)
King Wong as Jerry (16 years old)
Philip To as Will (19 years old)
Berry Lee as Ben (33 years old)
Lilian Ng as Dora (25 years old)

[b]Plot:[/b]
On 1 December the World Aids Day, while Ben was leading voluntary workers to distribute red ribbons, Mike thought it is a good chance to meet guys.  He met a handsome guy named Chris and hit on him; Don was hurt in a fight when he came out as gay, making Tom hide his sexual attitude even from his best friend; Mike called for a repair for his broken kitchen facet, then to his surprise, he had met the plumber before

A character study following 7 gay men and 1 woman.  Overall themes around acceptance, coming of age and safe sex.  Some parts do seem somewhat like an after school special, but there is a redeeming story at the heart of the series.  Although dealing with gay content, the series avoids being gratuitous and sexual situations are mostly discussed rather than portrayed
